newsitem.title: USA: CIBC hires utilities market professional.
newsitem.headline: CIBC hires utilities market professional.

text.p: CIBC Wood Gundy Securities Corp has hired Paul Kovich, a utilities industry expert, to develop the firm's capital markets efforts in the high-yield electric utility sector.
Kovich will serve as a managing director in CIBC's high-yield group. CIBC Woody Gundy is the U.S. securities subsidiary of the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce.
"The credit trend of the (utilities) industry is moving away from investment grade because of deregulation. We are trying to approach it from a new, high-yield perspecive," Kovich said.
"Like Captain Kirk said: 'This is the final frontier.'"

Kovich formerly worked as a capital market specialist in high-grade utilities for Bear Stearns & Co Inc, reporting to Lewis Sachs, senior managing director of corporate bond capital markets. Sachs did not immediately return calls.

Kovich also served as an investment banker covering the electric power industry for Bear Stearns, Kidder Peabody & Co and Lehman Brothers Inc. In his new position, he will report to Mario Monello, managing director and co-head of high yield sales and trading. Both worked at Lehman Brothers in the 1980s. Kovich did not immediately return calls.
